page.title: 11FOREST TOWN
page.content: I think Forest Town is alright to live in. Most of the people are friendly and there isn't much litter. We have our own village shops, church, youth club, dancing hall and three pubs. We have three schools. Some men work at the pit. Forest Town is very active in the mornings but we don't have many fairs or carnivals. But we have our problems with our neighbours. Forest Town has a farm with about two hundred acres and two big ponds. One is private and one is for leisure fishing. In the middle of one of the lakes is an island. Poachers are always shooting things at the farm. Most of Forest Town used to be Sherwood Forest. There is still a bit left but not much. Most of our rivers run into the River Trent. { LEE BENNETT
